page.title: 12Attitudes
page.content: A local resident who retired into the area from England has seen several cottages disappear into ruins because the land has been joined together to make larger farm units. Several houses were used as holiday cottages but in the last 5 years this has been halted and now the trend is for empty cottages to be bought, rebuilt or renovated by local people who live in them all the year round. He thinks that the farming industry would in the future level out and that the effect of the E.E.C. would mean that farmers would have to alter their pattern of farming. We have probably seen the end of the Golden Age of farming and the bigger the better argument would have to be replaced by a return to working the land as the demand dictated.
